title: How to Make Coffee Liqueur

steps.headline: Pour two cups of coffee with the two cups of vodka in the mixing jar and mix.
Set aside for at least two days to steep.
steps.description: Taste test to see if ready; leave longer if needed.

methods.name: Brandy and rum based - long infusion

steps.headline: Pour the water into a heavy-based saucepan.
Add the sugar, instant coffee powder and a few drops of vanilla extract.
Heat gently.
steps.description: Stir constantly until the sugar and instant coffee powder have dissolved. Allow it to cool.

steps.headline: Stir in the brandy and rum.
Pour the coffee liqueur into a bottle or decanter.
Store in a cool and dark place.
steps.description: Let the flavors infuse for 3 to 4 weeks before trying.

text: Vodka based - short infusion Cool and strain the coffee.  Pour two cups of coffee with the two cups of vodka in the mixing jar and mix.  Add the sugar and molasses. Stir through. Pour into a storage bottle.  Set aside for at least two days to steep. Taste test to see if ready; leave longer if needed. Brandy and rum based - long infusion Pour the water into a heavy-based saucepan.  Add the sugar, instant coffee powder and a few drops of vanilla extract.  Heat gently. Stir constantly until the sugar and instant coffee powder have dissolved. Allow it to cool. Stir in the brandy and rum.  Pour the coffee liqueur into a bottle or decanter. Seal. Store in a cool and dark place. Let the flavors infuse for 3 to 4 weeks before trying.
